trustfund:
TF021251-PHRD-JAPANESE CTF (USD ACCOUNT),TF037403-CHILE - PRIMARY ED&IMPROVMENT,TF035548-LAC  - HEALTH INSURANCE INFORM
            (ARGENTINA, URUGUAY)

abstracts.cdata!:
The project obtained its key objective:
            it attained most of the targets set for the different
            components and , in many instances, it exceeded the targets
            of the project components. Key lessons learned highlight the
            project characteristics that led to a successful outcome:
            long-term vision and permanence of objectives and teams
            (both the technical and political participants); focus on
            the learning process in the classroom and teacher role and
            participation; diversity of approaches used and their
            adaptation to the environment (context); and prioritization
            and sequencing of education changes. Specific lessons
            learned stress the following: the importance of constant
            monitoring in order to adjust programs in a timely fashion,
            and involving and training families which changed the way
            they participated and related to their children's
            education and to the school; the favorable effects of
            working with an intersectoral strategy that combines health
            and education institutions and buys services from health
            providers; the need to coordinate among the participating
            actors with advance planning to increase the utility of
            teaching materials and to train teachers and supervisors in
            their use; focusing on teachers needs and not just computer
            technology itself; creating awareness that infrastructure
            investment must be aimed at improving the quality of
            education; and the importance of changing from a clinical
            view of special education to a pedagogical one.
